botanical_details.genus: Chrysanthemum are erect woody-based perennials with aromatic, pinnately lobed leaves and flowerheads of diverse form, from late summer to late autumn

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in a sheltered site in full sun in fertile, well-drained soil enriched with organic matter and general-purpose fertiliser. Water freely in dry weather. Staking may be required. Plants should survive outdoors in most areas especially if protected by a thick mulch. In very cold areas lift the crowns and store in a greenhouse, raising fresh plants from these each year. See chrysanthemum cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by basal cuttings in early spring
how_to_grow.pruning: Pinch out the growing tip when the plants are 15-20cm tall to encourage free-flowering, bushy plants. Cut back to near ground level in the autumn. Deadhead regularly to prolong flowering
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to chrysanthemum leaf miner, glasshouse whitefly and aphids
how_to_grow.diseases: Susceptible to chrysanthemum white rust, powdery mildews and grey moulds
